name: disunity
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a situation in which people disagree so much that they can no longer work together effectively: It was all part of our enemies' plans to sow disunity in our society. All that talk of disunity and division was gone. See
disunite
More examplesFewer examplesWe have no desire to see disunity in the country.There is no disunity within the squad, as has been suggested.Internal disunity and the disastrous effects of war made Greece powerless against an outside invader.
